programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Jarrod and Brandi try to get the better of some inexperienced new faces on the auction circuit, while Barry attends a sale in Inglewood.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A Roman coin from 44 BC featuring Julius Caesar's portrait is brought into the shop, but it remains to be seen whether the owner will command a high price.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys head down to the shooting range to try out a pair of Duck's Foot pistols, where Chum sets out to prove he is a crack shot.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The Golds' reputation is at stake when a customer claims he was sold a fake watch, and Ashley makes a large offer for some gemstones.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les has to call security when an argument over a missing item turns violent, a high-stakes gambler visits the shop for funds and a customer tries to sell a gynaecologist's table.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: First episode of the series in which Pawn Stars' Rick Dale and his team try to make a profit out of fixing, restoring and transforming unusual objects.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Tyler struggles to stick to his budget during the restoration of a 1930s Eco-Tyre Meter, while Rick gets to work on a storm-damaged street lamp.

programme.title: Search for the Lost Giants
programme.desc: Brothers Jim and Bill Vieira investigate accounts of giant skeletons being found across America, to determine if these stories are true and who the bones belonged to.

programme.title: Unusual Suspects
programme.desc: The 1989 killing of Indianapolis high school student Amy Weidner while she stayed home from school, and the police's search for the motive - and murderer.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The buyers go to Dallas, where they attend several auctions in one day while facing a frantic race to keep up with the competition.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Ricky and Bubba buy a locker full of valuable sci-fi merchandise, while Victor makes a spectacular profit on his latest purchase.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: Investigating reports of UFO and USO activity in the Bermuda Triangle vicinity of the Atlantic Undersea Test and Evaluation Centre - AUTEC - said to be used by the US Navy for weapons testing and underwater research.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: UFOs are the biggest mystery of the age, yet somebody - or something - seems determined to keep it that way. This documentary seeks to assess why that may be the case.

programme.title: Inside Area 51's Secrets
programme.desc: Underground tunnels, hidden enemy aircraft, secret government UFO files... After years of silence, Area 51 insiders spill their secrets for the first time and reveal what's really been going on inside the most secretive place on Earth..

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz take their nephew on his first pick and visit the 1890s home that once belonged to an opera singer.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz visit a theme park during a clear-out and later discover some shocking news about a collection of circus posters.

programme.title: Ronnie O'Sullivan's American Hustle
programme.desc: Snooker player Ronnie O'Sullivan is joined by sports broadcaster Matt Smith to examine the US's 300-year association with the game of pool. The duo begin in New York City, hunting down the city's most notorious pool hustlers while meeting a few other interesting characters along the way.

programme.title: Ronnie O'Sullivan's American Hustle
programme.desc: Ronnie's relative obscurity among the Chicago locals might be the perfect set-up for a hustle, but not everything goes to plan for him and Matt Smith.

programme.title: Ronnie O'Sullivan's American Hustle
programme.desc: Ronnie O'Sullivan and Matt Smith hit the pool halls of Memphis for a rematch with Johnny Archer, one of the greatest players in pool history.

programme.title: Ronnie O'Sullivan's American Hustle
programme.desc: In their final stop on their hustling tour of America, Ronnie and Matt Smith hit San Francisco for what they hope will be one last score.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A one-of-a-kind Star Wars Boba Fett prototype action figure jetpacks into the shop, but it remains to be seen whether Rick will pay the bounty.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick gives a limited edition 2014 Hertz Penske GT Mustang a test drive around the Las Vegas Motor Speedway.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: An autographed picture of John Belushi and a Jim Henson puppet arrive in the shop, but it remains to be seen if any of them are worth big money.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A rare Nepalese Bira gun from the late 1800s arrives in the shop, and a 1970s Bob Peak TWA mural makes a big impression.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A hand-painted, signed guitar from Def Leppard's Phil Collen rocks into the shop.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A signed platinum disc from glam metal band Poison has Rick wondering whether it is worth adding to his record collection.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A Roman coin from 44 BC featuring Julius Caesar's portrait is brought into the shop, but it remains to be seen whether the owner will command a high price.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys head down to the shooting range to try out a pair of Duck's Foot pistols, where Chum sets out to prove he is a crack shot.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick saddles up and heads out to look at a 1980s Sigma Derby horse racing game, but it remains to be seen whether it will be worth a gamble.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Chum is over the moon when a pair of 1960s space robot toys arrive at the shop, but the owners asking price may bring him back down to Earth.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Staff at the Detroit family pawn shop encounter a gynaecologist's table and an elephant's skull.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les challenges Seth to a high-stakes sales competition, but later faces the most dangerous customer he has ever encountered.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Hordes of angry customers face hour-long queues, Les tries to work out whether a dealer is selling stolen goods, and a feud erupts between Seth and Andy.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth struggles with a negotiation on an exceptionally busy day, and Ashley tries to find a customer's missing guitar.

programme.title: The Curse of Oak Island
programme.desc: At Smith's Cove, Rick and Marty Lagina are excited to find an item that dates back as far as a century before the discovery of the Money Pit.

programme.title: Vampire Skeletons
programme.desc: Documentary examining skeletons unearthed in Ireland that appear to be treated as revenants who might return from the dead to prey on the living.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Extended edition. Question master Stephen Fry continues the comedy quiz's exploration of subjects beginning with the letter L as he asks a range of fiendish questions on the multisized worlds of the little and the large. Joining regular panellist Alan Davies are Pointless co-host Richard Osman and stand-ups Lucy Porter and Phill Jupitus, who are all hoping they don't fall into the QI elves' traps and set off the klaxon.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Topical comedy quiz show, hosted by Dara O Briain. Regular panellist Hugh Dennis looks back on another eventful week in news and politics, with the help of with the help of guests Angela Barnes, Ed Gamble, Rhys James, Nish Kumar and Tiff Stevenson. Stand-up and improvisation are the name of the game as the contestants try to get one up on each other.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Extended edition. Question master Stephen Fry continues the comedy quiz's exploration of subjects beginning with the letter L as he asks a range of fiendish questions on the topics of luck and loss. Joining regular panellist Alan Davies are Top Gear presenter Jeremy Clarkson and broadcasters Sandi Toksvig and Danny Baker, who are all hoping they don't fall into the QI elves' traps and set off the klaxon.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Extended edition. Question master Stephen Fry continues the comedy quiz's exploration of subjects beginning with the letter L as he asks a range of fiendish questions on the multisized worlds of the little and the large. Joining regular panellist Alan Davies are Pointless co-host Richard Osman and stand-ups Lucy Porter and Phill Jupitus, who are all hoping they don't fall into the QI elves' traps and set off the klaxon.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Nish Kumar, Clara Amfo, Anneka Rice and Al Murray compete in Double Points Friday, and their scores are tallied across the week resulting in an overall champion being crowned.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Topical comedy quiz show, hosted by Dara O Briain. Regular panellist Hugh Dennis looks back on another eventful week in news and politics, with the help of with the help of guests Angela Barnes, Ed Gamble, Rhys James, Nish Kumar and Tiff Stevenson. Stand-up and improvisation are the name of the game as the contestants try to get one up on each other.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The Hurting
programme.desc: Clip show featuring the voice of Jake Yapp, as home videos reveal the dumbest things attempted by adults, kids and even animals.

programme.title: The Hurting
programme.desc: Clip show featuring the voice of Jake Yapp, as home videos reveal the dumbest things attempted by adults, kids and even animals.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: In an episode originally shown in 2011, Jeremy Clarkson celebrates the 50th anniversary of the Jaguar E-type by driving a modern-day interpretation of the classic sports car, and throws a typically low-key party involving live music, fighter planes and the Royal Marines. Richard Hammond is in South Africa, where he tests the Marauder, a bigger, more rugged alternative to the Humvee, and James May enlists the help of 2010 Winter Olympic skeleton gold medallist Amy Williams and former Intercontinental Rally Challenge champion Kris Meeke to try out a Mini rally car. Plus, the Stig takes the BMW 1 Series M Coupe around the test track and Alice Cooper gets behind the wheel of the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Lori is angry when Brandon cuts a deal with rival Jesse.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Brandon and Lori are unsure of how to react when Jesse's bidding becomes aggressive.

programme.title: Aussie Pickers
programme.desc: Series following two pickers, Lucas Callaghan and Adam McDonald, who earn a living by restoring forgotten relics to their former glory, beginning with a visit to Jim Crocker, a collector and junk yard owner who specialises in Furphy water carts.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike makes a deal over some taxidermy animals and spots a retro billboard that could be worth a lot of money.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: Two males on bikes are spotted acting suspiciously near a cashpoint. One evades police and a pursuit ensues. A police dog undertakes its final shift.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: A group of angry locals trap an innocent man in a telephone box and accuse him of being a paedophile, and a woman claims her boyfriend is trying to kill her.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: Keith engages in a high-speed pursuit after spotting a car being driven with a flat tyre. Even after the tyre disintegrates at 90mph, the driver still refuses to stop.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May immerse themselves in nostalgia and try to prove that hot hatches from their younger days are better than today's equivalents. Jeremy grabs the keys to a Volkswagen Golf GTI, Richard takes the wheel of a Vauxhall Nova SRi and James May opts for the Ford Fiesta XR2i, and the trio set off on a road trip that includes a hill climb and a visit to a supermarket. However, their adventure concludes at an army training ground in Wales, where they and their steeds must face the heavily armed Top Gear Police Department. Downton Abbey star Hugh Bonneville blasts the Reasonably Priced Car around the test track.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The trio travel to Italy to test high-performance hatchbacks. Jeremy Clarkson is in the Citroen DS3 Racing, Richard Hammond champions the Fiat 500C Abarth and James May makes the case for the Renaultsport Clio 200 Cup as they navigate their way round baffling Italian towns and take part in a scavenger hunt, before putting the cars through their paces on the F1 street circuit in Monaco. Also, petrolhead comedian Ross Noble is in the Reasonably Priced Car and the McLaren MP4-12C supercar comes under review.

programme.title: Scrapyard Supercar
programme.desc: Pro driver Shane Lynch takes on engineer Ralph Hosier and his teams of mechanics, who are aiming to prove a supercar can be beaten by homemade scrap. This time, they get down and dirty in an off-road scramble versus the Bentley Bentayga - can a car synonymous with class and style be beaten by cars made from cast-offs?.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Actor Larry Lamb, comedian David O'Doherty and presenter Lauren Laverne join host Frank Skinner, making the case for their pet hates to be banished for ever. The trio's dislikes include high fives, fancy dress, ostentatious dresses, being 35, fake tan and square plates.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Seasoned rocker Alice Cooper, Who Wants to Be a Millionaire? host Chris Tarrant and wildlife presenter Chris Packham compete to have their pet hates banished for ever, on the comedy panel show chaired by Frank Skinner. Their gripes include reality TV stars, balloon animals, parrots, Jedward, Chris Moyles and kids' artwork on fridges.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner chairs the comedy panel show, inviting comedian Ross Noble, R'n'B singer Jamelia and academic Germaine Greer to compete to have their pet hates banished for ever. Their gripes include folk-dancing, health-and-safety, text speak, smelly people, actors and fun-runs.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lucy attends a three-day trade conference to drum up business, but when she has little luck she resorts to flirting with the male delegates. Lee is outraged with her plan, however, and in an attempt to stop her he turns up at the event - posing as her husband. Comedy, starring Lee Mack and Sally Bretton.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee gets jealous when Lucy talks about her first love, so Daisy helps him turn the tables by setting him up with her gorgeous friend. However, he is surprised when things start moving very quickly between them. Comedy, guest starring Joanna Bobin (Secret Diary of a Call Girl), with Lee Mack, Sally Bretton and Katy Wix.

credits.actor: Joanna Bobin (Secret Diary of a Call Girl)

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lucy's first love reappears on the scene and asks her to star in a play he has written especially for her. But Lee refuses to take it lying down and decides to fight for his flatmate's attention. Lee Mack and Sally Bretton star, with a guest appearance by Simon Farnaby (Horrible Histories).

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Topical comedy quiz show, hosted by Dara O Briain. Regular panellist Hugh Dennis looks back on another eventful week in news and politics, with the help of with the help of guests Angela Barnes, Ed Gamble, Rhys James, Nish Kumar and Tiff Stevenson. Stand-up and improvisation are the name of the game as the contestants try to get one up on each other.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Ed Gamble, Milton Jones, Miles Jupp, Nish Kumar and Felicity Ward join host Dara O Briain and regular participant Hugh Dennis for the topical comedy show, looking back at the week's events through the medium of fast-thinking and improvisation.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.sub-title: Have I Got a Bit More Old News for You
programme.desc: Comedian Rhod Gilbert takes over the reins for extended edition of the satirical quiz from May 2018, with comedy writer Andy Hamilton and politician Sayeeda Warsi joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: Train Truckers
programme.desc: Kevin Norris and Kieran Chisnall move three state-of-the-art trains, fresh in from Japan. They need to transport them from the North East port of Redcar to a factory in Doncaster.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: How Europe's most advanced power station became a film set. Plus, the structures made by scientific pioneer Nikola Tesla in his quest to provide the US with free electricity.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: An account of Hitler's decision to invade the Soviet Union, which produced an initial series of dazzling victories until the harsh winter of 1941 took hold, with fatal consequences for the ill-equipped German army. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: Experts analyse the work of engineers including Sir Nigel Gresley, who engineered the world's fastest steam train in 1938 and Eric Laithwaite, whose linear motor made frictionless travel a possibility. These innovators influenced the engineering of the Shanghai Maglev, the fastest passenger train in operation on Earth, which broke numerous engineering boundaries in its construction. Held in place by a series of electromagnets, it levitates on an air gap of 10mm and is able to reach a top speed of 431kms per hour.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Medieval Dead
programme.desc: The skeleton dubbed the Warrior of Janakkala, found in Finland. The swords buried alongside the man suggest a link between Christians and Pagans and it has been deduced the remains date from the 12th century.

programme.title: Medieval Dead
programme.desc: The team travels to Montsegur in France to investigate the massacre of hundreds of Cathars in 1244.

programme.title: Royal Murder Mysteries
programme.desc: The crime documentary continues, shedding light on rumours that Princess Anastasia, daughter of Tsar Nicholas II, managed to escape death at the hands of the Bolsheviks in 1918.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: Unusual rail networks designed to traverse water, including the Indian Ocean, the earthquake zones of the Bosphorus Strait and the sea cliffs of the Italian Riviera.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: The drive to make trains faster, from supersonic rocket sleds to engines that seem to fly above their guideways.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: Since their meteoric rise in the 19th Century, railways have been at the forefront of modern engineering. They've conquered dizzying altitudes, wilderness, seas and cities..

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: Since their rise in the 19th Century, railways have been at the forefront of modern engineering and transport, conquering dizzying altitudes, wilderness, seas and cities..

programme.title: Wonders of the Monsoon
programme.desc: Colin Salmon narrates a documentary exploring how the lives of humans and animals across a vast area of the planet are affected by the transforming power of the monsoon rains. The end of the dry season in northern Australia sees 300,000 flying foxes gathering to drink while running a gauntlet of freshwater crocodiles, while in Sumatra a female orang-utan guides her youngster to where she knows a fig tree fruits at this time of year. At the Delhi stock exchange, the price of rice escalates every day the rains fail to materialise and priests submerge themselves in water and beseech Varuna, god of water, to come.

programme.title: Wonders of the Monsoon
programme.desc: The effect of the rainy season on wildlife in Asia, with floods forcing animals to flee from Kaziranga National Park in north-east India in search of the safety of the hills. In Cambodia, the Mekong river swells so much that water is forced back up one of its tributaries to fill the vast Tonle Sap lake - one of the most productive freshwater fisheries on Earth. Fresh grass draws nomads and their vast herds of livestock back to their homelands, but they are stalked by hungry wolves and hyenas, which move in at night for the kill. Colin Salmon narrates.

programme.title: Wonders of the Monsoon
programme.desc: The other side of the monsoon, as the winds bring dry air and drought. Budgerigars swarm in the Australian desert, gathering at a precious waterhole, and although birds of prey try to ambush them, they are mesmerised by the array of bright colours on show. On the island of Borneo, a bearded pig hunts for seafood on the beach, while in the Rajasthan desert, nomads haggle over the price of camels, which can provide vital transport during this lean season. The mugger crocodiles of Sri Lanka stalk the animals taking a much-needed drink and a young leopard learning to hunt discovers there is no such thing as an easy meal. Colin Salmon narrates.

programme.title: Wonders of the Monsoon
programme.desc: Colin Salmon narrates a documentary exploring how the lives of humans and animals across a vast area of the planet are affected by the transforming power of the monsoon rains. The end of the dry season in northern Australia sees 300,000 flying foxes gathering to drink while running a gauntlet of freshwater crocodiles, while in Sumatra a female orang-utan guides her youngster to where she knows a fig tree fruits at this time of year. At the Delhi stock exchange, the price of rice escalates every day the rains fail to materialise and priests submerge themselves in water and beseech Varuna, god of water, to come.

programme.title: Wonders of the Monsoon
programme.desc: The effect of the rainy season on wildlife in Asia, with floods forcing animals to flee from Kaziranga National Park in north-east India in search of the safety of the hills. In Cambodia, the Mekong river swells so much that water is forced back up one of its tributaries to fill the vast Tonle Sap lake - one of the most productive freshwater fisheries on Earth. Fresh grass draws nomads and their vast herds of livestock back to their homelands, but they are stalked by hungry wolves and hyenas, which move in at night for the kill. Colin Salmon narrates.

programme.title: Wonders of the Monsoon
programme.desc: The other side of the monsoon, as the winds bring dry air and drought. Budgerigars swarm in the Australian desert, gathering at a precious waterhole, and although birds of prey try to ambush them, they are mesmerised by the array of bright colours on show. On the island of Borneo, a bearded pig hunts for seafood on the beach, while in the Rajasthan desert, nomads haggle over the price of camels, which can provide vital transport during this lean season. The mugger crocodiles of Sri Lanka stalk the animals taking a much-needed drink and a young leopard learning to hunt discovers there is no such thing as an easy meal. Colin Salmon narrates.

programme.title: Guitar Heroes at the BBC
programme.desc: Status Quo play Pictures of Matchstick Men on Top of the Pops in 1968, the Who perform Long Live Rock in the Old Grey Whistle Test studio, Dire Straits deliver Tunnel of Love and Lynyrd Skynyrd bring a taste of the American South with Sweet Home Alabama. The programme also features rare performances from George Benson, Leo Kottke, Link Wray and Tom Petty.

programme.title: Guitar Heroes at the BBC
programme.desc: Archive footage from BBC music shows of the 1970s. Including electric performances by the Rolling Stones, Eric Clapton, David Bowie, Motorhead, Nazareth, AC/DC and George Thorogood, as well as acoustic material by Michael Chapman, Horslips and Paco de Lucia.

programme.title: The Queen's Castle
programme.desc: The Knights of the Garter arrive at Windsor Castle for their annual lunch with members of the monarchy, which includes a complicated procession through the palace. The royal archives allow cameras to view nearly 200 years of photo albums, including the thousands of photographs from the Queen Mother's collection, and the castle clock-maker faces a race to ensure all 450 timepieces on the estate are turned back.

programme.title: World's Greatest Palaces
programme.desc: Behind the scenes of Schnbrunn Palace in Austria, which is located in a 500-acre park and includes an orangery, palm house and one of Europe's oldest zoos.

programme.title: David Jason: Planes, Trains and Automobiles
programme.desc: The actor discovers the machines that made America. Here, he samples the luxury of 1930s aviation, drives the car that changed the world and climbs aboard a vintage steam train.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: A young boy falls into a creek and drowns, while his mother is found slumped in the hallway. Dr Stephen Andrews discovers both ingested rat poison, and suspicion falls on the grieving husband and father. The detective soon uncovers a sordid case of extortion and forgery as part of his investigation. Crime drama, starring Mark McManus.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: The sisters launch their spring collection for working women to much acclaim, which leads to Beatrice and Evie receiving an offer that has both business and personal consequences. Period drama, starring Stella Gonet and Louise Lombard.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Connie and Oswald join the holiday to see Billy and Aveline, and Joey's protest about the game shooting on the estate wins him an admirer.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: The sisters face up to the realities of life with their husbands in prison, and try to explain things to Tracey's son, Garth. Classic comedy, starring Pauline Quirke and Linda Robson.

programme.title: Cadfael
programme.desc: A juggler seeks sanctuary at the abbey, desperate to escape an angry mob who believe he attacked and robbed a goldsmith. Sensing that events are not what they seem, Cadfael investigates - and it is not long before another body is found floating in the river. Medieval mystery, starring Derek Jacobi.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: The roguish antiques dealer is arrested on suspicion of armed robbery - and to make matters worse, the only way he can clear his name is by admitting he was with a charming ex-girlfriend at the time. He must decide whether to come clean and face a jealous Charlotte's wrath, or take the consequences of the charge. Ian McShane stars.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: A penniless sculptor seeks the canny dealer's help to prise a considerable inheritance out of his avaricious brother. Celia Imrie guest stars, with Ian McShane.

programme.title: Sharpe
programme.desc: Sean Bean returns as Bernard Cornwell's swashbuckling hero, this time setting out to rescue British deserters captured by Spanish rebel El Casco. Along the way he crosses swords with a fellow officer and come to the aid of a damsel in distress. Daragh O'Malley, Hugh Fraser and John Tams also star.

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.desc: The group arrives in Germany with hopes of high wages and bierkellers full of frauleins, but the truth is much harder to bear. Dick Clement and Ian La Frenais's popular comic drama following the fortunes of English workers seeking their fortune overseas, starring Tim Healy, Kevin Whately, Timothy Spall and Jimmy Nail.

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.desc: Neville is suspended for lying about being a joiner, but manages to redeem himself by averting a disaster on the site. He is not only reinstated by Herr Ulrich, but allowed to work as a bricklayer - which is bad news for Oz, who is sacked to make way for him. Drama, starring Tim Healy, Kevin Whately, Timothy Spall and Jimmy Nail.

programme.title: The Evacuees
programme.desc: Jack Rosenthal's 1975 drama, directed by Alan Parker, chronicling the experiences of two Jewish boys evacuated from London to avoid the horrors of the Blitz. Maureen Lipman, Margery Mason and Ray Mort star.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The priest investigates the disappearance of a parishioner who believed she was being haunted by her sister, who went missing years before. Mark Williams stars in the 1950s-set crime drama based on the stories by GK Chesterton, with Sorcha Cusack, Hugo Speer and Tom Chambers.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: An ex-serviceman dies suddenly in the street, and Father Brown is called to investigate Danvers Retreat, a facility where the dead man was a patient. Fifties-set crime drama based on the stories by GK Chesterton, starring Mark Williams.

programme.title: The Brokenwood Mysteries
programme.desc: The annual wine show is a major event in Brokenwood and no one is looking forward to it more than DI Mike, the recent buyer of a 10-acre vineyard. However, when a guest judge and wine critic are found dead, drowned inside a fermenting vat, the show takes second place to the murder investigation. Neill Rea, Fern Sutherland, Pana Hema Taylor and Nic Sampson star.

programme.title: Frankie Drake Mysteries
programme.desc: Mob boss Bessie Starkman hires Frankie and Trudy to work at her illegal casino as a waitress and croupier, but Frankie ends up accused of murder.

programme.title: Wallander
programme.desc: Two bodies are discovered on a life raft in Ystad harbour, the victims having been shot through the head and had their tongues burnt off with acid. The heavily tattooed corpses reveal links to the Russian mob and are instrumental in proving the men originated from Latvia, so Major Karlis Liepa, an officer with the country's police department, is sent to work with Wallander. But an anonymous phone call, a shooting and a break-in at the police HQ soon convince Wallander of a leak in the investigation - and he immediately suspects Liepa. Guest starring Soren Malling (The Killing), with Kenneth Branagh as the world-weary detective.

credits.actor: Kenneth Branagh as the world-weary detective

programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.title: The Pledge
programme.desc: The panel members debate more of the big issues the whole country is talking about.

programme.desc: Review of the latest international news, with sport, weather and financial updates.

programme.title: Dancing on Ice
programme.desc: Following on from the launch show over Christmas, Phillip Schofield and Holly Willoughby host the start of the celebrity skating challenge, joined by judges Christopher Dean, Jayne Torvill, Ashley Banjo and new addition John 'Fabulous' Barrowman. This year's celebrities - six of whom will perform tonight - are Ben Hanlin, Caprice, Joe Swash, Kevin Kilbane, Libby Clegg, Lisa George, Lucrezia Millarini, Maura Higgins, Perri Kiely and Trisha Goddard and - in the show's first same-sex partnership - Ian 'H' Watkins. Michael Barrymore was due to compete, but a broken wrist has ruled him out, and he is replaced by Radzi Chinyanganya.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Thunderbirds Are Go
programme.desc: Kayo, with the help of a futuristic game creator that only talks like a wizard, must play through a futuristic holo-game called Cavern Quest to stop the Chaos Crew from stealing a powerful piece of technology.

programme.title: Dare Master
programme.desc: Danny takes on a BMX champion at the UK's national cycling centre. Can he win the race or will he get the cream pie forfeit?.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Madcap slapstick and mayhem as the celebrated cat and mouse plot against each other.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Jerry pretends to be a distinguished butler to gain access to the manor's pantry..

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Madcap slapstick and mayhem as the celebrated cat and mouse plot against each other.

programme.title: Scrambled!
programme.desc: Two hours of children's fun and entertainment.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Fizz and Weasel plan to enter Fizz's new condiment in a culinary contest. Magoo mistakes them for members of his band ready for a reunion..

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr. Bean disguises himself as a Pensioner in order to avoid lunch with Irma and her mum..

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: George finds a computer called Val but Val has a mind of her own. Soon she's set about uploading embarrassing videos to social media..

programme.title: Thunderbirds Are Go
programme.desc: While the members of International Rescue attend a prestigious global airshow, a test pilot unveils an ultra-fast superjet.

programme.title: Craig of the Creek
programme.desc: Craig of the Creek follows a young boy and his two friends as they go on adventures in a world of untamed, kid-dominated wilderness in the creek.

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James is joined by guests Kate Thornton and Lucy Alexander, and chefs Claude Bosi and Shaun Hill. With contributions from wine expert Oz Clarke and truffle hunter Zac Frost.

programme.title: John and Lisa's Weekend Kitchen
programme.desc: With Christmas behind them, John Torode and Lisa Faulkner present some light and fresh recipes to kick off the new year. They start with home-made granola and stewed fruit, Lisa makes a one-pot vegetarian pasta dish and a spiced cod tray bake and John demonstrates pearl barley with an array of mushrooms.

programme.title: Nadia's Family Feasts
programme.desc: Nadia Sawalha is joined by chef Eran Tibi to dish up a family feast from the Middle East. The menu comprises an Israeli mezze of stuffed brick and sweet potato hummus for breakfast, mussakhan for lunch, Eran's aubergine, tomato and beef stew for dinner and Nadia's cigar baklava with cheat's pistachio ice cream for dessert.

programme.title: The Masked Singer
programme.desc: Another six unknown celebrities battle it out in the singing contest that has taken other countries by storm. The mystery contestants are dressed head to toe in elaborate costumes designed to hide their identities, while the panel - Jonathan Ross, Davina McCall, Rita Ora and Ken Jeong - tries to guess who they are. By the end of the show, the second celebrity's identity will be revealed and they will be waving goodbye to the show. Joel Dommett hosts the proceedings.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Warwick Davis in which a team of family and friends answers questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then tries to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money.

programme.title: The Brits Are Coming
programme.desc: Alice Levine announces the 2020 Brit Award nominees live. With performances by some of 2019's biggest acts, including Liam Payne, Mabel, Aitch, Freya Ridings and Dermot Kennedy.

programme.title: Catchphrase
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts the game show, asking Strictly head judge Shirley Ballas, actress Bhavna Limbachia and This Morning's resident GP Dr Ranj Singh to 'see it and say it' as they try to guess the familiar phrases hidden in animated clues. The players battle to reach the Super Catchphrase round, where one of them could win 50,000 for their chosen charities.

programme.title: The Masked Singer
programme.desc: Five mystery celebrities battle it out in the singing contest that has taken other countries by storm. The contestants are dressed head to toe in elaborate costumes - Chameleon, Duck, Hedgehog, Queen Bee and Unicorn - designed to hide their identities, while the panel - Jonathan Ross, Davina McCall, Rita Ora and Ken Jeong - tries to guess who they are. By the end of the show, the third celebrity's identity will be revealed and they will be waving goodbye to the show. Joel Dommett hosts the proceedings.

programme.title: The Voice UK
programme.desc: Emma Willis hosts the latest round of the blind auditions in the spinning-chair singing contest, in which celebrity 'coaches' seek out the nation's best vocal talent. But there is a simple twist - with the four coaches selecting their teams through 'blind auditions', looks play no part in the selection process, meaning each singer is chosen on vocal ability alone. Meghan Trainor is the newest recruit to the judging panel, joining series regulars Olly Murs, Tom Jones and Will.i.am.

programme.title: Shopping with Keith Lemon
programme.desc: Keith goes rug shopping with antiques legend David Dickinson and visits an Asian supermarket with singer Lily Allen, while also talking about their life and career.

programme.title: Fast & Furious 7 (2015)
programme.desc: After defeating Owen Shaw and his crew and securing amnesty for their past crimes, Dom, Brian and the rest of the team return home to live normal lives again. However Shaw's older brother Deckard - a rogue special forces assassin vows revenge on Dom, who he holds responsible for leaving Owen in a coma. Action thriller sequel, starring Vin Diesel, Jason Statham and Paul Walker in his last film role.

credits.actor: Paul Walker in his last film role

programme.desc: From anthemic slow jams to throwback classics, Swarzy brings you an ultimate assembling of tracks that forged the direction and influenced the sound of R&B as we know it.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: A look at how seaweed is turned into sushi wrapping, how beer bottles that last for 15 years are made, and how surfers try to keep themselves safe from sharks.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer and Edd China work on an old Aston Martin DB7, hoping to restore it to its former glory but hidden problems threaten to blow their budget.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini revamps his 1934 MG in time for Monterey and heads out on a road trip in his BMC technical support bus.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.sub-title: Tent Find the New Barn Find?
programme.desc: Wayne Carini looks at a Dino that has been left in storage for 15 years and falls in love with it, despite it being infested with mice.

programme.title: Chaos Caught on Camera
programme.sub-title: Boiling Bus, Lethal Landslide, Risky Rescue
programme.desc: Footage of near disasters, featuring a bus full of passengers flooding with water, a kayaker trapped inside a waterfall and travellers being swallowed by a landslide.

programme.title: Chaos Caught on Camera
programme.sub-title: Tragic Tsunami, Plummeting Plane, Canadian Catastrophe
programme.desc: Footage of near disasters, featuring a train hauling toxic materials crashing into a trapped truck and a plane suffering engine failure while in flight.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: An out-of-control car crashes into a bakery, a base jumper is hit hard, a flood strikes a historic town and a rocket explodes just after take-off. Presented by Ron Pitts.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: Flash flooding causes havoc in a Spanish village, a liquid petroleum store in Brazil puts a residential area in danger, and a double motorbike crash is caught on camera.

programme.title: American Loggers
programme.desc: The winter freeze hits Millinocket in Maine, and disaster strikes when a rookie driver struggles to handle his vehicle on the roads and rolls his rig twice.

programme.title: Overhaulin'
programme.desc: Chip Foose and a team of mechanics repair and revamp tired old vehicles.

programme.title: Supercar Superbuild
programme.desc: Maserati takes on the challenge of trying to grow its business in an unusual way - by shrinking the supercar.

programme.title: Supercar Superbuild
programme.desc: Examining how Lamborghini retired one of the most famous models and replaced it with a new supercar.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Edd China gets to work on an old VW camper van, changing the exhaust and completing a diesel service.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Work on the camper van is completed, and the finished article proves very popular when it is snapped up by a buyer straight away.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Auto enthusiast Mike Brewer and mechanic Edd China try to breathe new life into an old VW Beetle.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. The VW Beetle begins to take shape as auto enthusiast Mike Brewer and expert mechanic Edd China continue their restoration, but things do not go according to plan.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer finds a rare, rust-free model of a Datsun 240Z California and Edd China swaps the auto for manual transmission, before the pair try to make a profit.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer sources a 181 Thing from a collector, but is forced to dig deep for the purchase, meaning there is not much money left in the kitty for Edd China's repair job.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Car restorer Wayne Carini helps Olympic gold medalist Jonny Mosely and the Squaw Valley ski resort find a vehicle that could have been at the 1960 Winter Olympics.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Tasmanian logging contractors the Bennett Brothers tackle forest tracks to move a huge tree winch. Elsewhere, a leaky fridge halts Woody's urgent frozen food delivery.

programme.title: Darts: BDO World Championships
programme.desc: Day seven from indigo at The O2 in London.

programme.title: Live Darts: BDO World Championships
programme.desc: Coverage of the afternoon session on day eight from indigo at the O2 in London, featuring the youth final and the opening men's semi-final.

programme.title: Goblin Works Garage
programme.desc: The team takes on its first ever EV build as its members attempt to mount a Tesla battery-powered electric powerplant inside a classic - the Cinquecento or Fiat 500

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: Classic Cars
programme.desc: Salvage aficionado Drew Pritchard visits Britain's oldest number plate maker. Plus, Paul and Drew disagree about adding a mega engine onto a tiny Italian classic..

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: Bitesize
programme.desc: In Derbyshire, Drew Pritchard finds a rare masterpiece in an attic, and he meets a collector in a converted chapel in Yorkshire. Later, in Harrogate, he finds a special antique.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard visits an upmarket Somerset showroom and buys a scruffy table full of potential. In Lancashire, he spots a Swedish design classic and a Soviet relic of the Cold War.

programme.title: EFL on Quest
programme.desc: A round-up of goals and highlights from the English Football League, including Leeds United v Sheffield Wednesday and Charlton Athletic v West Bromwich Albion.

programme.title: Combat Dealers
programme.desc: Military equipment collector Bruce Crompton is in the Philippines with Freddy where they find an artillery gun from the Japanese occupation in the Second World War.

programme.title: The Detectives: My Killer Case
programme.desc: Disturbing crimes from across the UK are unpacked and retold in intimate detail through police files, CCTV footage and accounts from those who helped solve them.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Forensic Detectives investigates the thin line between love and hate, while tracking the vicious histories of deadly lovers and their evil spouses.

programme.title: Copycat Killers
programme.desc: The case of James Eagan Holmes, who, in 2012 killed 12 people at a movie theatre in Aurora, Colorado, and later claimed to be the Joker from the Batman movies.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: A case from Oklahoma, where the Long Branch Saloon was the local hangout for many in the small town of Poteau. However, its beloved proprietor Joe Neff went missing in 2009, leaving behind a splatter of blood. His body was later retrieved from an old mining strip pit, but the identity of his killer remained a mystery.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: How a new DNA testing forensic procedure was introduced during the investigation into the disappearance of a Pennsylvanian woman and her infant son.

programme.title: Animal Cops San Francisco
programme.desc: A dog with a large tumour is rescued from a litter-strewn backyard, and Scott sets out to save a pit bull from heavy traffic.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: A baby cockatoo has fallen out of its nest, so Sydney veterinary surgeon Dr Chris Brown tries to help it fly once again.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Chris Brown fights to save Bluebell, who was dumped at the clinic as a kitten and has now fallen victim to a hit-and-run.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.sub-title: I Won the Battle Against My Twin
programme.desc: A bride tries to get her twin sister's approval of her dress, while another customer needs all four of her siblings to agree with her choice of gown.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Broadway star Kristin Chenoweth helps her best friend to find a dress with glitz and glam, while two sets of sisters fail to agree on a style.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Self-conscious Katie wonders whether her dream dress will fit, while Ivy's fiance insists she try on a gown that is four times her budget.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Chris Brown gets a terrible delivery when a kitten with shocking injuries turns up in a cardboard box, and Tim Faulkner struggles to remove a diamond python from a drain.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Chris Brown visits Beijing and treats his first hamster, is stunned to have to tend to some pet snails, and has an unforgettable encounter with giant pandas.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Forty four-year-old Erica binges on food when faced with adversity, and previous weight-loss surgery was unsuccessful. Can she get the support she needs to change her habits?.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Part one of two. The fortunes of talented musician and singer Brandon, whose addiction to food has left him incapacitated. He now risks losing his girlfriend and his career dreams.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Part two of two. The fortunes of talented musician and singer Brandon, whose addiction to food has left him incapacitated. He now risks losing his girlfriend and his career dreams.

programme.title: Being Reuben
programme.desc: Welsh school boy and internet sensation Reuben de Maid is chasing his dream of becoming famous. He reflects on the bullying he has endured both online and in real life.

programme.title: Being Reuben
programme.desc: Grandad Bampa takes the kids camping for the weekend. Later on, Reuben has a photoshoot for a brand-new beauty app and brings Bampa along to show him his world.

programme.title: Say Yes: Wedding SOS
programme.desc: Couch-lovers Lisa and Vinny are getting wed but had no time to focus on themselves, so style expert George Kotsiopoulos tries to revive them in time for the big day.

programme.title: Say Yes: Wedding SOS
programme.desc: George tries to help busy couple Jessica and David, who have let style and fashion slide thanks to full-time jobs and raising a son.

programme.title: Say Yes: Wedding SOS
programme.desc: George tries to save the day for Brittany and Justin, who were just one month away from their wedding date when a fire destroyed everything they had.

programme.title: Say Yes: Wedding SOS
programme.sub-title: No Dress, No Suit, No Venue, Oh My!
programme.desc: Kristen and Max have taken their chill lifestyle to the extreme. With only weeks until their wedding, there is no dress or venue in sight.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Two friends want the same dress for their wedding, while another pair of customers try to keep their gowns secret from each other.

programme.title: Long Island Medium
programme.sub-title: Spirit in Paradise: The Son Also Visits
programme.desc: Larry Jr visits Theresa in Florida while his father is away, and takes her places she would never go with her husband.

programme.title: Long Island Medium
programme.desc: Theresa Caputo has to choose whether her family will live in Florida or Long Island. She also surprises a detective and 'channels' her own brother.

programme.title: Long Island Medium
programme.desc: Theresa Caputo performs readings for expectant mothers so they can resolve personal issues before giving birth.

programme.title: Hoarding: Buried Alive
programme.desc: The story of Lalie, who is suffering a mice infestation because her neighbour has acquired one of the biggest hoards seen on the show.

programme.title: Murder By Numbers
programme.desc: The murder of a woman on the Appalachian Trail. Her husband was missing and as more people disappeared, investigators had to consider whether a deadly predator was stalking the woods.

programme.title: Faking It: Tears of a Crime
programme.desc: Experts analyse a man's deception following the 2017 Manchester Arena terror attack. Police tapes expose the lies of a man who murdered his wife and hid her body in the freezer.

programme.title: Inside Death Row with Trevor McDonald
programme.desc: Part one of two. The broadcaster ventures inside Indiana State Prison, meeting 12 condemned men awaiting execution and some of the other inmates in the maximum-security facility. Among those he talks to are Benjamin Ritchie, who murdered a policeman, and John Stephenson, who killed three people on the orders of a gang boss, while James Harrison reveals how he escaped the death penalty with only weeks to spare after accepting a deal of life inside. Trevor also visits the 1950s-style barber shop where all the hairdressers are convicts, including Rick Pearish, who explains why they are given permission to use cut-throat razors and sharp implements.
